context: Tests whether the agent follows core TDD red-green-refactor cycle principles when implementing new functionality from scratch.

checklist.name: Test-first implementation
checklist.description: Evidence shows failing tests were written before implementation code (commit history, comments, or documentation)

checklist.name: Verified test failures
checklist.description: Shows evidence of running tests to confirm they fail before implementation (comments, logs, or documentation)

checklist.name: Minimal implementation
checklist.description: Initial implementation is minimal to make tests pass, not over-engineered

checklist.name: Refactoring evidence
checklist.description: Shows improvement/cleanup of code after tests pass (multiple versions or comments about refactoring)

checklist.name: Red-green cycle discipline
checklist.description: Multiple test/implementation cycles visible, not one big implementation

checklist.name: Test structure follows AAA
checklist.description: Tests use clear Arrange-Act-Assert structure with logical separation

checklist.name: One Act per test
checklist.description: Each test performs only one action/method call in the Act phase

checklist.name: Single behavior per test
checklist.description: Each test verifies one logical concept, not multiple behaviors combined

checklist.name: Descriptive test names
checklist.description: Test names describe scenario and expected outcome clearly
